Ingest_LDD.name: Geometry Dictionary
Ingest_LDD.comment: Version 0.5.0.0 Removed unit_of_measure_type from geometry_reference_time, Added *Relative-To_Sun* velocity vectors. Version 0.5.1.0 Corrected the data type for central-body_name, Moved these attributes to Spacecraft_Geometry and removed them from all other classes: geometry reference time, reference frame id, central-body name, central-body naif id, target identification, target naif id. Changed the cardinality of Spacecraft Geometry to (0,*). Added a SPICE-style Quaternion to the Image Display class options. Added a new class, Pixel Dimensions. Version 0.5.2.0 Made identifying the central-body optional unless a class refers to central-body (Schematron rule) Made the various naif_id attributes either optional or part of a choice with the corresponding (non-naif specific) name attribute Changed light_time_flag and stellar_aberration_flag renamed to light_time_correction_applied and stellar_aberration_ correction_applied, changed their enumerated values to Yes and No, made them nillable for migrated data. Changed construction of the various specific vectors to be instances of a basic vector rather than contain that basic vector class Corrected the cardinalities of the Specific_Vectors class and each of the vector classes within it Made all attributes in Pixel_Dimensions class optional Made disp:Display_Direction optional with a Schematron rule requiring it to appear in the Display Discipline Area or in the geom:Image_Display_Geometry class when that class is invoked. Added the classes: Footprint_Vertices Pixel_Intercept Reference_Pixel Surface_Geometry Added the attributes: central-body_north_pole_clock_angle pixel_latitude pixel_longitude sub_solar_azimuth sub_solar_latitude sub_solar_longitude sub_spacecraft_azimuth sub_spacecraft_ latitude sub_spacecraft_ longitude target_north_pole_clock_angle target_positive_pole_clock_angle Removed the attributes: solar_longitude (duplicated attribute in pds:Time_Coordinates) sun_direction_clock_angle from the Illumination_Single_Values class

DD_Attribute.name: geometry_reference_time
DD_Attribute.definition: geometry_reference_time is the time at which each of the values in the containing class is correct. Note: [mkg] I'm placing this as a required field once in the label. There are alternative approaches: 1) place in each subclass in stead of one global value 2) require a global value with an optional entry in subclasses. Value at the lowest level takes precedence over the global value.

DD_Attribute.name: coordinate_space
DD_Attribute.definition: The coordinate_space indicates location of the origin and the time of instantiation of the coordinate system.

DD_Attribute.name: reference_location
DD_Attribute.definition: The reference_location indicates the position to which values in the containing class apply. If the reference location is on a target, the target is the one specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Values were determined for the point where the boresight vector intersects the designated target.
Values were determined for the subspacecraft point on the designated target.
Values were determined for the center of the designated target.

DD_Attribute.name: central-body_name
DD_Attribute.definition: central-body_name is the PDS recognized name for the central-body associated with the observation (the planet in a planetary system).

DD_Attribute.name: central-body_naif_id
DD_Attribute.definition: central-body_naif_id is the numerical ID assigned by the PDS NAIF node for the central-body associated with the observation (the planet in a planetary system).

DD_Attribute.name: target_naif_id
DD_Attribute.definition: target_naif_id is the numerical ID assigned by the PDS NAIF node for the target.

DD_Attribute.name: reference_pixel_location
DD_Attribute.definition: The reference_pixel_location indicates the position of the pixel to which values in the containing class apply.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Values were determined for the intersection of a vector through the center of the field of view with the specified target.
Values were determined for the intersection of a vector through the upper left corner of the field of view with the specified target.
Values were determined for the intersection of a vector through the lower left corner of the field of view with the specified target.
Values were determined for the intersection of a vector through the upper right corner of the field of view with the specified target.
Values were determined for the intersection of a vector through the lower right corner of the field of view with the specified target.

DD_Attribute.name: pixel_line
DD_Attribute.definition: pixel_line is the vertical coordinate of a specific pixel.

DD_Attribute.name: pixel_sample
DD_Attribute.definition: pixel_sample is the horizontal coordinate of a specific pixel.

DD_Attribute.name: north_azimuth
DD_Attribute.definition: Assuming the image is displayed as defined by the Display_Direction class, the north_azimuth attribute provides the value of the angle between a line from the image center to the north pole and a reference line in the image plane. The reference line is a horizontal line from the image center to the middle right edge of the image. This angle increases in a clockwise direction.

DD_Attribute.name: east_azimuth
DD_Attribute.definition: Assuming the image is displayed as defined by the Display_Direction class, the east_azimuth attribute provides the value of the angle between a line from the image center to the east and a reference line in the image plane. The reference line is a horizontal line from the image center to the middle right edge of the image. This angle increases in a clockwise direction.

DD_Attribute.name: right_ascension
DD_Attribute.definition: The right_ascension attribute provides the value of right ascension, which is defined as the arc of the celestial equator between the vernal equinox and the point where the hour circle through the point in question intersects the celestial equator (reckoned eastward). Right ascension is used in conjunction with the declination attribute to specify a point on the sky.

DD_Attribute.name: declination
DD_Attribute.definition: The declination attribute provides the value of an angle on the celestial sphere, measured north from the celestial equator to the point in question. (For points south of the celestial equator, negative values are used.) declination is used in conjunction with the right_ascension attribute to specify a point on the sky.

DD_Attribute.name: celestial_north_clock_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The celestial_north_clock_angle attribute specifies the direction of celestial north at the center of an image. It is measured from the 'upward' direction, clockwise to the direction toward celestial north, assuming the image is displayed as defined by the Display_Direction class..

DD_Attribute.name: ecliptic_north_clock_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The ecliptic_north_clock_angle attribute specifies the direction of ecliptic north at the center of an image. It is measured from the 'upward' direction, clockwise to the direction toward ecliptic north, assuming the image is displayed as defined by the Display_Direction class..

DD_Attribute.name: sun_direction_clock_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The sun_direction_clock_angle attribute specifies the direction of the sun as an angle measured from a line 'upward' from the center of the field of view, clockwise to the direction toward sun, assuming the image is displayed as defined by the Display_Direction class..

DD_Attribute.name: target_positive_pole_clock_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The target_positive_pole_clock_angle element specifies the direction of the target body's rotation axis in an image. It is measured from the 'upward' direction in the image, clockwise to the direction of the positive rotational pole as projected into the image plane, assuming the image is displayed as defined by the Display_Direction class. The positive pole is used to define the poles of dwarf planets, minor planets, their satellites, and comets according to the right-hand rule. "positive" is the pole toward which the thumb points when the fingers are curled in the body's direction of rotation.

DD_Attribute.name: target_north_pole_clock_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The target_north_pole_clock_angle element specifies the direction of the target body's rotation axis in an image. It is measured from the 'upward' direction in the image, clockwise to the direction of the northern rotational pole as projected into the image plane, assuming the image is displayed as defined by the Display_Direction class. The north pole of a planet or any of its satellites in the solar system is the pole of the rotation axis that is in the same celestial hemisphere relative to the invariable plane of the solar system as Earth's North pole.

DD_Attribute.name: central-body_north_pole_clock_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The central-body_north_pole_clock_angle element specifies the direction of the central body's (e.g., planet's)rotation axis in an image. It is measured from the 'upward' direction in the image, clockwise to the direction of the northern rotational pole as projected into the image plane, assuming the image is displayed as defined by the Display_Direction class. The north pole of a planet or any of its satellites in the solar system is the pole of the rotation axis that is in the same celestial hemisphere relative to the invariable plane of the solar system as Earth's North pole.

DD_Attribute.name: q1
DD_Attribute.definition: The first component of a quaternion.

DD_Attribute.name: q2
DD_Attribute.definition: The second component of a quaternion.

DD_Attribute.name: q3
DD_Attribute.definition: The third component of a quaternion.

DD_Attribute.name: q4
DD_Attribute.definition: The fourth component of a quaternion.

DD_Attribute.name: horizontal_pixel_size_angular
DD_Attribute.definition: The horizontal_pixel_size_angular provides the angular measure of the horizontal field of view of a single pixel. This is equivalent to the PDS3 element horizontal_pixel_field_of_view.

DD_Attribute.name: vertical_pixel_size_angular
DD_Attribute.definition: The vertical_pixel_size_angular provides the angular measure of the vertical field of view of a single pixel. This is equivalent to the PDS3 element vertical_pixel_field_of_view.

DD_Attribute.name: horizontal_pixel_size_projected
DD_Attribute.definition: The horizontal_pixel_size_projected provides the the horizontal field of view of a single pixel projected onto the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class. Analogus to PDS3 keyword PIXEL_SCALE

DD_Attribute.name: vertical_pixel_size_projected
DD_Attribute.definition: The vertical_pixel_size_projected provides the the vertical field of view of a single pixel projected onto the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class. Analogus to PDS3 keyword PIXEL_SCALE

DD_Attribute.name: horizontal_pixel_scale_factor
DD_Attribute.definition: The horizontal_pixel_scale_factor provides a scaling factor which when multiplied by the distance to a point of the surface of the target identified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class gives the horizontal size of a pixel projected on the target in units of length (e.g., kilometers).

DD_Attribute.name: vertical_pixel_scale_factor
DD_Attribute.definition: The vertical_pixel_scale_factor provides a scaling factor which when multiplied by the distance to a point of the surface of the target identified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class gives the vertical sizes of a pixel projected on the target in units of length (e.g., kilometers).

DD_Attribute.name: pixel_latitude
DD_Attribute.definition: The pixel_latitude attribute gives the value of the planetocentric latitude on the target of the projection of a specified pixel.

DD_Attribute.name: pixel_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: The pixel_longitude attribute gives the value of the planetocentric longitude on the target of the projection of a specified pixel.

DD_Attribute.name: subsolar_azimuth
DD_Attribute.definition: The subsolar_azimuth attribute provides the value of the angle between the line from the center of an image to the subsolar point on the target and a horizontal reference line (in the image plane) extending from the image center to the middle right edge of the image. The values of this angle increase in a clockwise direction.

DD_Attribute.name: subsolar_latitude
DD_Attribute.definition: The subsolar_latitude attribute gives the value of the planetocentric latitude at the subsolar point on the target.

DD_Attribute.name: subsolar_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: The subsolar_longitude attribute gives the value of the planetocentric longitude at the subsolar point on the target.

DD_Attribute.name: subspacecraft_azimuth
DD_Attribute.definition: The subspacecraft_azimuth attribute provides the value of the angle between the line from the center of an image to the subspacecraft point on the target and a horizontal reference line (in the image plane) extending from the image center to the middle right edge of the image. The values of this angle increase in a clockwise direction.

DD_Attribute.name: subspacecraft_latitude
DD_Attribute.definition: The subspacecraft_latitude attribute gives the value of the planetocentric latitude at the subspacecraft point on the target.

DD_Attribute.name: subspacecraft_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: The subspacecraft_longitude attribute gives the value of the planetocentric longitude at the subspacecraft point on the target.

DD_Attribute.name: illumination_range_designation
DD_Attribute.definition: The illumination_range_designation indicates whether values given in the Illumination_Range_Values class apply to the entire field of view, or the portion within the field of view of the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Values were determined for the field of view.
Values were determined for the portion within the field of view of the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Attribute.name: emission_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The emission_angle element provides the value of the angle between the surface normal vector at the intercept point and a vector from the intercept point to the spacecraft. The emission_angle varies from 0 degrees when the spacecraft is viewing the subspacecraft point (nadir viewing) to 90 degrees when the intercept is tangent to the surface of the target body. Thus, higher values of emission_angle indicate more oblique viewing of the target. Values in the range of 90 to 180 degrees are possible for ring data.

DD_Attribute.name: minimum_emission_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum_emission_angle element provides the smallest value for the emission angle in the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_emission_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum_emission_angle element provides the largest value for the emission angle in the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: incidence_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The incidence_angle element provides a measure of the lighting condition at the intercept point. Incidence angle is the angle between the local vertical at the intercept point (surface) and a vector from the intercept point to the sun. The incidence_angle varies from 0 degrees when the intercept point coincides with the subsolar point to 90 degrees when the intercept point is at the terminator (i.e., in the shadowed or dark portion of the target body). Thus, higher values of incidence_angle indicate the existence of a greater number of surface shadows. Note: In PDS labels for Magellan's altimetry and radiometry products, and for Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter Mini-RF products, incidence_angle is defined as the value of the angle between the local vertical and the spacecraft direction. For Magellan this is measured at the center of the radiometer footprint at rad_spacecraft_epoch_time.

DD_Attribute.name: minimum_incidence_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum_incidence_angle element provides the smallest value for the incidence angle in the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_incidence_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum_incidence_angle element provides the largest value for the incidence angle in the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: phase_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The phase_angle element provides a measure of the relationship between the instrument viewing position and incident illumination (such as solar light). Phase_angle is measured at the target; it is the angle between a vector to the illumination source and a vector to the instrument. If not specfied, the target is assumed to be at the center of the instrument field of view. If illumination is from behind the instrument, phase_angle will be small.

DD_Attribute.name: minimum_phase_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum_phase_angle element provides the smallest value for the phase angle in the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_phase_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum_phase_angle element provides the largest value for the phase angle in the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_elongation
DD_Attribute.definition: [mkg: PDS3 does not give a value range; I do, so make sure I haven't missed something.] The solar_elongation element gives the angle between the line of sight of observation and the direction of the Sun. Note: For IRAS: The line of sight of observation is the boresight of the telescope as measured by the satellite sun sensor.

DD_Attribute.name: distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The distance attribute provides the scaler distance between to objects or points.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_to_target-center_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_to_target-center_distance attribute provides the scaler distance between the spacecraft and the center of the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_to_target-boresight-intercept_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_to_target-boresight-intercept_distance attribute provides the scaler distance between the spacecraft and the boresight vector intercept point on the surface of the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_to_target-subspacecraft_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_to_target-subspacecraft_distance attribute provides the scaler distance between the spacecraft and the subspacecraft point on the surface of the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_to_central-body_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_to_central-body_distance attribute provides the scaler distance between the spacecraft and the center of the central body (e.g., the center of Mars when opperating in the Mars system).

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_geocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_geocentric_distance attribute provides the scaler distance between the spacecraft and the center of Earth.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_heliocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_heliocentric_distance attribute provides the scaler distance between the spacecraft and the center of the Sun.

DD_Attribute.name: target_geocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The target_geocentric_distance attribute provides the scaler distance between the center of the target and the center of the Earth.

DD_Attribute.name: target_heliocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The target_heliocentric_distance attribute provides the scaler distance between the center of the target and the center of the Sun.

DD_Attribute.name: target_ssb_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The target_ssb_distance attribute provides the scaler distance between the center of the target and the Solar System Barycenter.

DD_Attribute.name: from_naif_id
DD_Attribute.definition: from_naif_id is the numerical ID assigned by the PDS NAIF node for the "from" object (e.g., the origin end of a vector).

DD_Attribute.name: to_naif_id
DD_Attribute.definition: to_naif_id is the numerical ID assigned by the PDS NAIF node for the "to" object (e.g., the endpoint of a vector).

DD_Attribute.name: from_name
DD_Attribute.definition: from_name is the PDS recognized name of the object at the origin of a vector quantity.

DD_Attribute.name: to_name
DD_Attribute.definition: to_name is the PDS recognized name of the object at the endpoint of a vector quantity.

DD_Attribute.name: light_time_correction_applied
DD_Attribute.definition: The light_time_correction_applied is a yes-or-no flag that indicates whether a light travel time correction was used when calculating the values in the enclosing class. The attribute is nillable with nill_reason = unknown, but only for migrated data.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Light travel time was used when calculating the values in the enclosing class.
Light travel time was not used when calculating the values in the enclosing class.

DD_Attribute.name: stellar_aberration_correction_applied
DD_Attribute.definition: The stellar_aberration_correction_applied is a yes-or-no flag that indicates whether a stellar abberation correction was used when calculating the values in the enclosing class. The attribute is nillable with nill_reason = unknown, but only for migrated data.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Stellar abberation time was used when calculating the values in the enclosing class.
Stellar abberation time was not used when calculating the values in the enclosing class.

DD_Attribute.name: x_p
DD_Attribute.definition: The x component of a Cartisean position vector.

DD_Attribute.name: y_p
DD_Attribute.definition: The y component of a Cartisean position vector.

DD_Attribute.name: z_p
DD_Attribute.definition: The z component of a Cartisean position vector.

DD_Attribute.name: x_v
DD_Attribute.definition: The x component of a Cartisean velocity vector.

DD_Attribute.name: y_v
DD_Attribute.definition: The y component of a Cartisean velocity vector.

DD_Attribute.name: z_v
DD_Attribute.definition: The z component of a Cartisean velocity vector.

DD_Attribute.name: x_a
DD_Attribute.definition: The x component of a Cartisean acceleration vector.

DD_Attribute.name: y_a
DD_Attribute.definition: The y component of a Cartisean acceleration vector.

DD_Attribute.name: z_a
DD_Attribute.definition: The z component of a Cartisean acceleration vector.

DD_Attribute.name: rad_p
DD_Attribute.definition: The radial component of a spherical or cylindrical position vector (e.g., the radius coordinate in Planetocentric coordinates).

DD_Attribute.name: lon_pc_p
DD_Attribute.definition: The longitudinal component of a Planetocentric position vector. Planetocentric longitude is measured from the IAU approved prime meridian for the body and increases toward the east.

DD_Attribute.name: lat_pc_p
DD_Attribute.definition: The latitude component of a Planetocentric position vector. Planetocentric latitude is the angle between the equator plane and a vector connecting the point of interest and the origin of the coordinate system. Latitudes are defined to be positive in the northern (as defined by the IAU) hemisphere.

DD_Attribute.name: rad_v
DD_Attribute.definition: The radial component of a spherical or cylindrical velocity vector.

DD_Attribute.name: lon_pc_v
DD_Attribute.definition: The longitudinal component of a Planetocentric velocity vector. Planetocentric longitude is measured from the IAU approved prime meridian for the body and increases toward the east.

DD_Attribute.name: lat_pc_v
DD_Attribute.definition: The latitude component of a Planetocentric velocity vector. Planetocentric latitude is the angle between the equator plane and a vector connecting the point of interest and the origin of the coordinate system. Latitudes are defined to be positive in the northern (as defined by the IAU) hemisphere.

DD_Class.name: Reference_Pixel
DD_Class.definition: The reference_pixel class provides the pixel coordinates, line and sample, to which values in the containing class apply.

DD_Class.name: Object_Orientation_North_East
DD_Class.definition: The Object_Orientation_North_East class provides the parameters needed to describe the orientation of an external coordinate system relative to the image coordinate frame as described by the Image_Orientation class.

DD_Class.name: Object_Orientation_RA_Dec
DD_Class.definition: The Object_Orientation_RA_Dec class provides the parameters needed to describe the orientation of the celestial reference frame relative to the image coordinate frame as described by the Image_Orientation class.

DD_Class.name: Object_Orientation_Clock_Angles
DD_Class.definition: The Object_Orientation_Clock_Angles class provides the clock angles measure from the center of the field of view to celestial and ecliptic north, and to the sun.

DD_Class.name: Object_Orientation_Quaternion_SPICE_Style
DD_Class.definition: The Object_Orientation_Quaternion_SPICE_Style class provides a quaternion that provides the transformation information from the instrument reference frame to the specified reference frame. The four components of a SPICE style quaternion (Qcos, Qsin1, Qsin2, Qsin3) are given by q1,q2,q3,q4 respectively.

DD_Class.name: Generic_Distance
DD_Class.definition: The distance between the two objects, both of which must be specified.

DD_Class.name: Pixel_Size_Projected
DD_Class.definition: The Pixel_Size_Projected class gives the size, in units of length (e.g., kilometers) of the projection of a pixel onto the surface of the target which is specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class. The reference_location attribute is used to identify the specific point on the target.

DD_Class.name: Illumination_Single_Values
DD_Class.definition: The Illumination_Single_Values class contains attributes providing illumination parameters at a single location in the field of view. If reference_location is used, and indicates a point on a target, the target must be the one specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Class.name: Illumination_FOV-Range_Values
DD_Class.definition: The Illumination_FOV-Range_Values class contains attributes providing illumination parameters as minimum/maximum pairs for either the field of view or the portion in the FoV of the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Class.name: Basic_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Basic_Position_Vector_Cartesian. A three dimensional, rectangular coordinates vector. Uses units of length. The included attributes are not sufficient to identify the endpoints of the vector. While the attribute coordinate_space is optional, if it is appropriate for this vector, it must be used here if the coordinate space has not been specified in the Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Class.name: Basic_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Basic_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian. A three dimensional, rectangular coordinates vector. Uses units of linear velocity. The included attributes are not sufficient to identify the endpoints of the vector. While the attribute coordinate_space is optional, if it is appropriate for this vector, it must be used here if the coordinate space has not been specified in the Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Class.name: Basic_Acceleration_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Basic_Acceleration_Vector_Cartesian. A three dimensional, rectangular coordinates vector. Uses units of linear acceleration. The included attributes are not sufficient to identify the endpoints of the vector. While the attribute coordinate_space is optional, if it is appropriate for this vector, it must be used here if the coordinate space has not been specified in the Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Class.name: Basic_Position_Vector_Planetocentric
DD_Class.definition: The Basic_Position_Vector_Planetocentric is a three dimensional spherical vector (radius, longitude, latitude) with the angular coordinates defined to be consistent with the Planetocentric coordinate system. Uses linear units for the radius dimension, and angular units for the other two dimensions. The included attributes are not sufficient to identify the endpoints of the vector. While the attribute coordinate_space is optional, if it is appropriate for this vector, it must be used here if the coordinate space has not been specified in the Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Class.name: Basic_Velocity_Vector_Planetocentric
DD_Class.definition: The Basic_Velocity_Vector_Planetocentric is a three dimensional spherical vector (radius, longitude, latitude) with the angular coordinates defined to be consistent with the Planetocentric coordinate system. Uses linear velocity units for the radius dimension, and angular velocity units for the other two dimensions. The included attributes are not sufficient to identify the endpoints of the vector. While the attribute coordinate_space is optional, if it is appropriate for this vector, it must be used here if the coordinate space has not been specified in the Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Class.name: Generic_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: Generic_Position_Vector_Cartesian. A three dimensional, rectangular coordinates vector. Uses units of length. Includes attributes to identify the endpoints of the vector.

DD_Class.name: Generic_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: Generic_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian. A three dimensional, rectangular coordinates vector. Uses units of linear velocity. Includes attributes to identify the endpoints of the vector.

DD_Class.name: Generic_Acceleration_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: Generic_Acceleration_Vector_Cartesian. A three dimensional, rectangular coordinates vector. Uses units of linear acceleration. Includes attributes to identify the endpoints of the vector.

DD_Class.name: Generic_Position_Vector_Planetocentric
DD_Class.definition: The Generic_Position_Vector_Planetocentric is a three dimensional spherical vector (radius, longitude, latitude) with the angular coordinates defined to be consistent with the Planetocentric coordinate system. Uses linear units for the radius dimension, and angular units for the other two dimensions. Includes attributes to identify the endpoints of the vector.

DD_Class.name: Generic_Velocity_Vector_Planetocentric
DD_Class.definition: The Generic_Velocity_Vector_Planetocentric is a three dimensional spherical vector (radius, longitude, latitude) with the angular coordinates defined to be consistent with the Planetocentric coordinate system. Uses linear velocity units for the radius dimension, and angular velocity units for the other two dimensions. Includes attributes to identify the endpoints of the vector.

DD_Class.name: Central-Body_To_Spacecraft_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Central-Body_To_Spacecraft_Position_Vector_Cartesian is a linear, rectangular coordinates vector from the center of mass of the central body (e.g., planet) to the spacecraft.

DD_Class.name: Central-Body_To_Target_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Central-Body_To_Target_Position_Vector_Cartesian is a linear, rectangular coordinates vector from the center of mass of the central body (e.g., planet) to the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_To_Target_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Spacecraft_To_Target_Position_Vector_Cartesian is a linear, rectangular coordinates vector from the spacecraft to the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Class.name: Central-Body_To_Spacecraft_Position_Vector_Planetocentric
DD_Class.definition: The Central-Body_To_Spacecraft_Position_Vector_Planetocentric is a spherical position vector in Planetocentric coordinates. It extends from the center of mass of the central body (e.g., planet) to the spacecraft.

DD_Class.name: Central-Body_To_Target_Position_Vector_Planetocentric
DD_Class.definition: The Central-Body_To_Target_Position_Vector_Planetocentric is a spherical position vector in Planetocentric coordinates. It extends from the center of mass of the central body (e.g., planet) to the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_To_Target_Position_Vector_Planetocentric
DD_Class.definition: The Spacecraft_To_Target_Position_Vector_Planetocentric is a spherical position vector in Planetocentric coordinates. It extends from the spacecraft to the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class..

DD_Class.name: SSB_To_Central-Body_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The SSB_To_Central-Body_Position_Vector_Cartesian is a linear, rectangular coordinates vector from the Solar System Barycenter to the central body (e.g., planet).

DD_Class.name: SSB_To_Spacecraft_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The SSB_To_Spacecraft_Position_Vector_Cartesian is a linear, rectangular coordinates vector from the Solar System Barycenter to the spacecraft.

DD_Class.name: SSB_To_Target_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The SSB_To_Target_Position_Vector_Cartesian is a linear, rectangular coordinates vector from the Solar System Barycenter to the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Class.name: Sun_To_Central-Body_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Sun_To_Central-Body_Position_Vector_Cartesian is a linear, rectangular coordinates vector from the Sun to the central body (e.g., planet).

DD_Class.name: Sun_To_Spacecraft_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Sun_To_Spacecraft_Position_Vector_Cartesian is a linear, rectangular coordinates vector from the Sun to the spacecraft.

DD_Class.name: Sun_To_Target_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Sun_To_Target_Position_Vector_Cartesian is a linear, rectangular coordinates vector from the Sun to the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Class.name: Earth_To_Central-Body_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Earth_To_Central-Body_Position_Vector_Cartesian is a linear, rectangular coordinates vector from the Earth to the central body (e.g., planet).

DD_Class.name: Earth_To_Spacecraft_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Earth_To_Spacecraft_Position_Vector_Cartesian is a linear, rectangular coordinates vector from the Earth to the spacecraft.

DD_Class.name: Earth_To_Target_Position_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Earth_To_Target_Position_Vector_Cartesian is a linear, rectangular coordinates vector from the Earth to the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_Relative-To_Central-Body_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Spacecraft_Relative-To_Central-Body_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian is a velocity vector in rectangular coordinates that gives the velocity of the spacecraft with respect to the central body (e.g., planet).

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_Relative-To_Target_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Spacecraft_Relative-To_Target_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian is a velocity vector in rectangular coordinates that gives the velocity of the spacecraft with respect to the target specified in the parent Spacecraft_Geometry class.

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_Relative-To_Earth_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Spacecraft_Relative-To_Earth_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian is a velocity vector in rectangular coordinates that gives the velocity of the spacecraft with respect to Earth.

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_Relative-To_SSB_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Spacecraft_Relative-To_SSB_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian is a velocity vector in rectangular coordinates that gives the velocity of the spacecraft with respect to the Solar System Barycenter.

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_Relative-To_Sun_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: Spacecraft_Relative-To_Sun_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian is a velocity vector in rectangular coordinates that gives the velocity of the spacecraft with respect to the center of the Sun.

DD_Class.name: Target_Relative-To_Central-Body_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Target_Relative-To_Central-Body_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian is a velocity vector in rectangular coordinates that gives the velocity of the designated target with respect to the central body (e.g., planet).

DD_Class.name: Target_Relative-To_Spacecraft_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Target_Relative-To_Spacecraft_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian is a velocity vector in rectangular coordinates that gives the velocity of the designated target with respect to the spacecraft.

DD_Class.name: Target_Relative-To_Earth_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Target_Relative-To_Earth_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian is a velocity vector in rectangular coordinates that gives the velocity of the designated target with respect to Earth.

DD_Class.name: Target_Relative-To_SSB_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: The Target_Relative-To_SSB_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian is a velocity vector in rectangular coordinates that gives the velocity of the designated target with respect to the Solar System Barycenter.

DD_Class.name: Target_Relative-To_Sun_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian
DD_Class.definition: Target_Relative-To_Sun_Velocity_Vector_Cartesian is a velocity vector in rectangular coordinates that gives the velocity of the designated target with respect to the center of the sun.

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_Relative-To_Target_Velocity_Vector_Planetocentric
DD_Class.definition: The Spacecraft_Relative-To_Target_Velocity_Vector_Planetocentric is a spherical velocity vector in Planetocentric coordinates that gives the velocity of the spacecraft with respect to the designated target.

DD_Class.name: Target_Relative-To_Central-Body_Velocity_Vector_Planetocentric
DD_Class.definition: The Target_Relative-To_Central-Body_Velocity_Vector_Planetocentric is a spherical velocity vector in Planetocentric coordinates that gives the velocity of the target with respect to the central body.

DD_Class.name: Target_Relative-To_Spacecraft_Velocity_Vector_Planetocentric
DD_Class.definition: The Target_Relative-To_Spacecraft_Velocity_Vector_Planetocentric is a spherical velocity vector in Planetocentric coordinates that gives the velocity of the target with respect to the spacecraft.

DD_Class.name: Specific_Position_Vectors
DD_Class.definition: The Specific_Position_Vectors class is a container class for all position vectors with pre-identified endpoints.

DD_Class.name: Specific_Velocity_Vectors
DD_Class.definition: The Specific_Velocity_Vectors class is a container class for all velocity vectors with pre-identified endpoints.

DD_Class.name: Generic_Vectors
DD_Class.definition: The Generic_Vectors class is a container class for all of the build your own vector templates.

DD_Class.name: Distances
DD_Class.definition: The Distances class is a container class for distances.

DD_Class.name: Pixel_Dimensions
DD_Class.definition: The Pixel_Dimensions class contains information regarding pixel size.

DD_Class.name: Pixel_Intercept
DD_Class.definition: The Pixel_Intercept class the latitude and longitude on the surface of the target for the projection of the specificed pixel. The pixel is specfied using either reference_pixel_location or Reference_Pixel. Although each of these is optional, one must be used.

DD_Class.name: Footprint_Vertices
DD_Class.definition: The Footprint_Vertices class provides a set of associations between pixels and their projections on the target. The pixels should be choose to be the vertices of a polygon, plotted sequenually in a the direction.

DD_Class.name: Surface_Geometry
DD_Class.definition: The Surface_Geometry class contains classes and attributes for various points of the surface of the target designated in the enclosing Spacecraft_Geometry.

DD_Class.name: Illumination_Geometry
DD_Class.definition: The Illumination_Geometry class contains two optional classes used to describing the field of view lighting.

DD_Class.name: Image_Display_Geometry
DD_Class.definition: Image_Display_Geometry class provides an unambiguous description of the orientation of the image contents. Given an image, displayed as described by the Display_Direction class, any one of the Object_Orientation_* classes should allow unambiguous orientation of the contents of the image. The use of disp:Display_Direction is optional, but must be given either here or in the Display Discipline Area of the label.

DD_Class.name: Spacecraft_Geometry
DD_Class.definition: The Spacecraft_Geometry class is a container for geometric information (positions, velocities, orientations, etc.) relevant to spacecraft based observations.

DD_Class.name: Geometry
DD_Class.definition: The Geometry class is a container for all geometric information in the label.
